comment: Offset: -0.9 •LS processed by 3-way stop cock (100x) •1mL in (1:1 ratio) is used  •Half of the constructs are not attached to the head, and are "hanging" whilst being connected to the rest on the head  •Individual constructs are separated with spatula •Inhomogenous distribution of hydrogel and LS: some discs show more LS ratio, others more hydrogel
next steps: •Residual ink is covered by plate lid to protect against evaporation, decreasing temperature and sticky residuals on VAT •Constructs are washed with warm PBS and gently removed with a spatula (wet it with PBS before to simplify removal) •Print head is cleaned  •Residual ink is removed as much as possible avoiding scrathing of the VAT, but no cleaning of VAT necessary as 2 print runs with identical ink are conducted and only one layer is exposed (thereby minimizing the risk of disruptive sticky remains on VAT)

comment: Offset: -0.9 •LS processed by 3-way stop cock (100x) •1mL in (1:1 ratio) is used •Constructs remain on VAT, PBS is added with a pipet to gently remove the discs from the VAT --> constructs deattached easily and are tranferred in one unit to a 6cm plate with PBS for further separation  •Individual constructs are separated with spatula •Inhomogenous distribution of hydrogel and LS
next steps: •Print head & VAT are cleaned  •Out of the 18, 16 constructs are selected and placed in DMEM high glucose+10%FBS+1%P/S (2304XYMB)  •Printing with next condition is initiated

comment: Offset: -0.9 •LS processed by 3-way stop cock (20x) •1mL in (1:1 ratio) is used •Individual constructs are separated with spatula •Inhomogenous distribution of hydrogel and LS: some discs show more LS ratio, others more hydrogel
next steps: •Residual ink is covered by plate lid to protect against evaporation, decreasing temperature and sticky residuals on VAT •Constructs are washed with warm PBS and gently removed with a spatula (wet it with PBS before to simplify removal) •Print head is cleaned  •Residual ink is removed as much as possible avoiding scrathing of the VAT, but no cleaning of VAT necessary as 2 print runs with identical ink are conducted and only one layer is exposed (thereby minimizing the risk of disruptive sticky remains on VAT)

comment: Offset: -0.9 •LS processed by 3-way stop cock (20x) •1mL in (1:1 ratio) is used •Constructs remain on VAT, PBS is added with a pipet to gently remove the discs from the VAT --> constructs deattached easily and are tranferred in one unit to a 6cm plate with PBS for further separation  •Individual constructs are separated with spatula •Inhomogenous distribution of hydrogel and LS
next steps: •Print head & VAT are cleaned  •Out of the 18, 16 constructs are selected and placed in DMEM high glucose+10%FBS+1%P/S (2304XYMB)  •Printing with next condition is initiated

comment: Offset: -0.9 •Unprocessed LS  •1mL in (1:1 ratio) is used •It is nearly impossible to distinguish between individual constructs as LS pieces are bigger, looks like a big mass of LS  •More than half of the constructs are not attached to the head, and are "hanging" whilst being connected to the rest on the head  •During separation attempt with spatula individual discs become discernable and are successfully separated  •Inhomogenous distribution of hydrogel and LS
next steps: •Residual ink is covered by plate lid  •Constructs are washed with warm PBS and gently removed with a spatula •Print head is cleaned  •Residual ink is removed as much as possible avoiding scrathing of the VAT

comment: Offset: -0.9 •Unprocessed LS •1mL in (1:1 ratio) is used •Similar results as in print attempt 5 but constructs are again attached to the VAT and removed with the help of PBS
next steps: •Print head & VAT are cleaned  •16 constructs are selected and placed in DMEM high glucose+10%FBS+1%P/S (2304XYMB)
